00028 ## In this module you can find various functions that help calendar 
00029 # widgets (date, time & datetime) in View.Form, View.Tree and 
00030 # Search modules. Probably others will use them in the future. These 
00031 # functions provide very simple ways of parsing user input, and here we define 
00032 # the standard output format too. Also from and to Storage functions are 
00033 # provided that ensure date and time are formated the way the storage system 
00034 # expects.
00035 #
00036 # Also a calendar popup is provided for use in widgets.
00037 #
00038 from PyQt4.QtCore import *
00039 from PyQt4.QtGui import * 
00040 from PyQt4.uic import *
00041 import math
00042 import Common
00043 
00044 ## @brief Converts a QDate object into a Python string
00045 def dateToText( date ):
00046         return str( date.toString( 'dd/MM/yyyy' ) )
00047 
00048 ## @brief Converts a QTime object into a Python string
00049 def timeToText( time ):
00050         return str( time.toString( 'hh:mm:ss' ) )
00051 
00052 ## @brief Converts a QDateTime object into a Python string
00053 def dateTimeToText( dateTime ):
00054         return str( dateTime.toString( 'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm:ss' ) )
00055 
00056 ## @brief Converts a float (type floatTime) into a Python string
00057 def floatTimeToText( value ):
00058         t = '%02d:%02d' % (math.floor(abs(value)),round(abs(value)%1+0.01,2) * 60)
00059         if value<0:
00060                 t = '-'+t
00061         return t
00062 
00063 ## @brief Converts a float (type floatTime) into a QTime
00064 def floatTimeToTime( value ):
00065         if value < 0:
00066                 return QTime( 0, 0 )
00067         return QTime( math.floor(abs(value)), round(abs(value)%1+0.01,2) * 60 )
00068 
00069 ## @brief Converts a QDate object into a Python string ready to be sent to the 
00070 # server.
00071 def dateToStorage( date ):
00072         if date.isValid():
00073                 return str( date.toString( 'yyyy-MM-dd' ) )
00074         else:
00075                 return False
00076 
00077 ## @brief Converts a QTime object into a Python string ready to be sent to the 
00078 # server.
00079 def timeToStorage( time ):
00080         if time.isValid():
00081                 return str( time.toString( 'hh:mm:ss' ) )
00082         else:
00083                 return False
00084         
00085 ## @brief Converts a QDateTime object into a Python string ready to be sent to 
00086 # the server.
00087 def dateTimeToStorage( dateTime ):
00088         if dateTime.isValid():
00089                 return str( dateTime.toString( 'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss' ) )
00090         else:
00091                 return False
00092 
00093 ## @brief Converts a Python string or QString into a QDate object
00094 def textToDate( text ):
00095         if unicode( QString( text ).trimmed() ) == '=':
00096                 return QDate.currentDate()
00097 
00098         inputFormats = ["dd/MM/yyyy", "dd-MM-yyyy", 'dd-MM-yy', 'dd/MM/yy', 'dd-M-yy', 'd-M-yy', 'd-MM-yy']
00099         for x in inputFormats:
00100                 date  = QDate.fromString( text, x )
00101                 if date.isValid():
00102                         break
00103         return date
00104 
00105 ## @brief Converts a Python string or QString into a QTime object
00106 def textToTime( text ):
00107         text = unicode( text ).strip()
00108         if text == '=':
00109                 return QTime.currentTime()
00110 
00111         inputFormats = ['h:m:s', 'h:m', 'hh:mm:ss', 'h.m.s', 'h.m', 'h']
00112         for x in inputFormats:
00113                 time = QTime.fromString( text, x )
00114                 if time.isValid():
00115                         break
00116 
00117         if not time.isValid():
00118                 if len(text) == 4:
00119                         # Try to convert '1234' to '12:34'
00120                         time = QTime.fromString( '%s:%s' % ( text[0:2], text[2:4] ), 'h:m' )
00121                 elif len(text) == 6:
00122                         # Try to convert '123456' to '12:34:56'
00123                         time = QTime.fromString( '%s:%s:%s' % ( text[0:2], text[2:4], text[4:6] ), 'h:m:s' )
00124         return time
00125 
00126 ## @brief Converts a Python string or QString into a QDateTime object
00127 def textToDateTime( text ):
00128         if unicode( QString( text ).trimmed() ) == '=':
00129                 return QDateTime.currentDateTime()
00130 
00131         inputFormats = ['dd/MM/yyyy h:m:s', "dd/MM/yyyy", "dd-MM-yyyy", 'dd-MM-yy', 'dd/MM/yy', 'dd-M-yy', 'd-M-yy', 'd-MM-yy' ]
00132         for x in inputFormats:
00133                 datetime = QDateTime.fromString( text, x )
00134                 if datetime.isValid():
00135                         break
00136         return datetime
00137 
00138 ## @brief Converts a Python string into a float (floatTime) 
00139 def textToFloatTime( text ):
00140         try:
00141                 if text and ':' in text:
00142                         return round(int(text.split(':')[0]) + int(text.split(':')[1]) / 60.0,2)
00143                 else:
00144                         return locale.atof(text)
00145         except:
00146                 return 0.0
00147 
00148 ## @brief Converts a Python string comming from the server into a QDate object
00149 def storageToDate( text ):
00150         if text:
00151                 date = QDate.fromString( text, 'yyyy-MM-dd' )
00152                 if date.isValid():
00153                         return date
00154                 # Sometimes we want datetime fields to be shown in pure date widgets
00155                 return QDateTime.fromString( text, 'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss' ).date()
00156         else:
00157                 return QDate()
00158 
00159 ## @brief Converts a Python string comming from the server into a QTime object
00160 def storageToTime( text ):
00161         if text:
00162                 return QTime.fromString( text, 'h:m:s' )
00163         else:
00164                 return QTime()
00165 
00166 ## @brief Converts a Python string comming from the server into a QDateTime object
00167 def storageToDateTime( text ):
00168         if text:
00169                 return QDateTime.fromString( text, 'yyyy-MM-dd h:m:s' )
00170         else:
00171                 return QDateTime
00172 
00173 
00174 (PopupCalendarUi, PopupCalendarBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('datetime.ui') )
00175 
00176 ## @brief The PopupCalendarWidget class provides a simple way to show a calendar 
00177 # where the user can pick up a date. 
00178 #
00179 # You simply need to call PopupCalendarWidget(widget) where widget
00180 # should be a QLineEdit or similar. The Popup will fill in the date itself.
00181 #
00182 # If you want the user to be able to select date and time, specify showTime=True
00183 # when constructing the object.
00184 #
00185 # You may force the pop-up to store and close with the storeOnParent() function.
00186 #
00187 # Of course, PopupCalendarWidget uses the other ToTime and ToText helper functions.
00188 #
00189 class PopupCalendarWidget(QWidget, PopupCalendarUi):
00190         ## @brief Constructs a PopupCalendarWidget. 
00191         # If showTime is True, the user will be able to select the time too.
00192         def __init__(self, parent, showTime = False):
00193                 QWidget.__init__(self, parent)
00194                 PopupCalendarUi.__init__(self)
00195                 self.setupUi( self )
00196 
00197                 self.showTime = showTime
00198                 if self.showTime:
00199                         self.uiTime.setText( textToDateTime( unicode(parent.text()) ).time().toString() )
00200                         self.connect( self.uiTime, SIGNAL('returnPressed()'), self.storeOnParent )
00201                 else:
00202                         self.uiTime.hide()
00203                         self.labelTime.hide()
00204 
00205                 self.setWindowFlags( Qt.Popup )
00206                 self.setWindowModality( Qt.ApplicationModal )
00207                 pos = parent.parent().mapToGlobal( parent.pos() )
00208                 self.move( pos.x(), pos.y() + parent.height() )
00209                 self.connect( self.uiCalendar, SIGNAL('activated(QDate)'), self.storeOnParent )
00210                 if self.showTime:
00211                         self.uiCalendar.setSelectedDate( textToDateTime( parent.text() ).date() )
00212                 else:
00213                         self.uiCalendar.setSelectedDate( textToDate( parent.text() ) )
00214                 self.uiCalendar.setFirstDayOfWeek( Qt.Monday )
00215                 self.show()
00216                 if self.showTime:
00217                         self.uiTime.setFocus()
00218                 else:
00219                         self.uiCalendar.setFocus()
00220 
00221         ## @brief Stores the currently selected date (or date and time) in the parent widget
00222         # and closes the popup. It also emits a 'selected()' signal.
00223         def storeOnParent(self):
00224                 date = self.uiCalendar.selectedDate()
00225                 text = dateToText( date )
00226                 if self.showTime: 
00227                         time = textToTime( self.uiTime.text() )
00228                         if time.isValid():
00229                                 text = text + ' ' + timeToText(time)
00230                         else:
00231                                 text = text + ' ' + '00:00:00'
00232                 self.parent().setText( text )
00233                 self.emit(SIGNAL('selected()'))
00234                 self.close()
